summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from July 31 to August 1, 2019, regarding Jeffrey Epstein's condition at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The emails discuss a request for notes on a reported suicide attempt, with a psychologist speculating on the nature of his injuries.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email chain; an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center whose reported suicide attempt and condition are being discussed.

events.title: Request for Notes on Epstein Suicide Attempt
events.description: An initial email request is made for notes on Jeffrey Epstein's reported suicide attempt.

events.title: Discussion of Epstein's Injuries
events.description: A psychologist responds to the request, providing notes and speculating that Epstein's injuries could be a suicide attempt, a ploy, inflicted by someone else, or self-inflicted 'rug burn' to call attention to his situation.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center
locations.address: 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
locations.context: The federal prison where Jeffrey Epstein was held; the location from which the correspondence originates.

keyFacts: An email chain from July 31-August 1, 2019, discusses obtaining notes on Jeffrey Epstein's reported suicide attempt in custody.
A Chief Psychologist speculates that Epstein's injuries might not be a genuine suicide attempt but could be a 'ploy', inflicted by someone else, or self-inflicted 'rug burn' to gain attention.
The correspondence highlights internal discussions and uncertainty among Bureau of Prisons staff regarding the nature of Epstein's injuries shortly before his death.
The document is a direct communication between Department of Justice/Bureau of Prisons personnel regarding a high-profile inmate's welfare.
